snippet: In Cairo, Secretary of State John Kerry indicated that additional steps needed to be taken to establish an inclusive, civilian-led government.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry presses Egyptian leaders to stick to their plan for restoring democracy, in highest-level American visit since Egyptian military removed country's first democratically elected president from power; Kerry's visit to to Egypt reflects, in both substance and tone, Obama administration's determination to work with a military leadership that ruthlessly put down protesters from Muslim Brotherhood.
lead_paragraph: In Cairo, Secretary of State John Kerry indicated that additional steps needed to be taken to establish an inclusive, civilian-led government.

headline.main: Egyptians Following Right Path, Kerry Says
headline.print_headline: Egyptians Following Right Path, Kerry Says

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
